v.v: Then Job answered and said,
“How long will you make me suffer
These ten times you have reproached me;
If it is indeed true that I have erred,
If indeed you will exalt yourselves above me
then you should know that God has done wrong to me
See, I cry out, “Violence!” but I get no answer.
He has walled up my way so that I cannot pass,
He has stripped me of my glory,
He has broken me down on every side, and I am gone;
He has also kindled his wrath against me;
His troops come on together;
He has put my brothers far from me;
My kinsfolk have failed me;
Those who once stayed as guests in my house and my female servants regard me as a stranger;
I call to my servant, but he gives me no answer
My breath is offensive to my wife;
Even young children despise me;
All my familiar friends abhor me;
My bones cling to my skin and to my flesh;
Have pity upon me, have pity upon me, my friends,
Why do you pursue me like God does?
Oh, that my words were now written down!
Oh, that with an iron pen and lead
But as for me, I know that my Redeemer lives,
after my skin, that is, this body, is destroyed,
I will see him with my own eyes—I, and not someone else.
If you say, ‘How we will persecute him!
then be afraid of the sword,

v: and break me into pieces with words?
you are not ashamed that you have treated me harshly.
my error remains my own concern.
and use my humiliation against me,
and has caught me in his net.
I call out for help, but there is no justice.
and he has set darkness in my path.
and he has taken the crown from my head.
he has pulled up my hope like a tree.
he regards me as one of his adversaries.
they cast up siege mounds against me
and encamp around my tent.
my acquaintances are wholly alienated from me.
my close friends have forgotten me.
I am an alien in their sight.
although I entreat him with my mouth.
I am even disgusting to those who were born from my mother’s womb.
if I rise to speak, they speak against me.
those whom I love have turned against me.
I survive only by the skin of my teeth.
for the hand of God has touched me.
Will you ever be satisfied with my flesh?
Oh, that they were inscribed in a book!
they were engraved in the rock forever!
and that at last he will stand on the earth;
then in my flesh I will see God.
My heart fails within me.
The root of his troubles lies in him,’
because wrath brings the punishment of the sword,
so that you may know there is a judgment.”
